clues.text: "Porcine" word for a horribly littered-up room
To corrupt morally, or darken wood chemically
"U" know this 7-letter adjective describes hair that hasn't been combed in a while
The verb "to soil" shares the same Latin root as this verb that means the same
Harry Truman said, "It is not the American way to" this fancy word "the character of the innocent"
The Gabor are a Roma group around the city Targu Mures in this country that sounds like it should have a large Roma minority & does
A vardo is a Roma one of these conveyances; Roald Dahl owned one & wrote a book about a boy who lives in one
Making do with foods others might ignore, the Roma developed culinary dishes like niglo, this quilled mammal baked in clay
The Roma were targeted by the Nazis & August 2 is a day of remembrance for almost 3,000 killed at this camp on that date in 1944
This legendary Roma jazz player who lacked the use of 2 left fingers has inspired generations of guitarists
In "U Can't Touch This", he rapped his thanks to the Lord "for blessing me with a mind to rhyme & 2 hyped feet"
Making their Top 40 debut in 1991, this vocal group told us, "Motownphilly's back again, doin' a little East Coast swing"
Ladies love this cool guy who was both "Doin It" & "Loungin" in 1996
In 1992 this vocal group who are always in style sang, "No, you're never gonna get it" about "My Lovin"'
"I'm kinda buzzed & it's all because" of this Montell Jordan No. 1 R&B hit; we also learned "South Central does it like nobody does"

rounds.comments: (Ken: Each response is a word with two "U"s; it has nothing to do with the band.)

clues.text: Mike Myers played a "Love" one in a 2008 film
Word describing a diamond in original form, or a movie that hasn't seen an editor yet
A lever turns on one
Moses' mom put him in an ark made of this plant
To yield, as to an overwhelming force or injury
In 1099, 3 years after setting out, the first crusaders achieved their goal, the capture of this city
The 1095 Council of Clermont called for the First Crusade but also renewed the Pax Dei, this in English
European Christians launched the First Crusade in response to an appeal for help from Alexius Comnenus, ruler of this empire
After capturing this Middle Eastern city in 1098, crusaders found what they thought was the holy lance (not the holy hand grenade)
Pope Eugenius III launched the Second Crusade in 1145 with "quantum praedecessores", one of these documents named for its seal

It's got some heat:
kcal

It makes fat & muscle relative:
BMI

For a closer look:
MRI

They are in power across the pond & elsewhere:
BTU

It's a good find:
RADAR
In his Netflix film this comic says he wanted to call his series "Betwixt Two Ferns", but thought it too highbrow
Elizabeth Banks & Patrick Stewart were both Bosleys in the 2019 adaptation of the TV show about this title trio
In the film version of this TV show, Crockett & Tubbs left the Sunshine State for a bit to go to Cuba & Haiti
Last names Heidecker & Wareheim, these 2 title funny guys got a "Billion Dollar Movie" in 2012
A tagline for the 2008 "Sex and the City" movie urged viewers to "Get" this verb "Away"
Prince tune that turns into a sudsy song that you sing on a long car ride
clues.response: "1999 Bottles Of Beer On The Wall"

clues.text: The iPhone is introduced & a marital temptation arises
Fateful year for the Titanic & a movie in which Henry Fonda plays a juror
William Henry Harrison wins an election; a short nap ensues
The year of the Battle of Waterloo leads to Andy Warhol's suggested period of notoriety
This pair in a fruit & dairy dessert also describes a pale-skinned, pink-cheeked complexion
Pair of building materials used to describe a physical store as opposed to an online retailer
A preposition & an adjective of size, together they're a synonym for "in general"
A blues classic says, "Nobody knows you when you're" this destitute pair
A wild speech & a wild party (maybe with glow sticks) combine in this alliterative pair meaning to express anger
In a 1977 movie Tatooine is the home planet of this Jedi-to-be
Infant Kal-El's father & mother send their baby in a rocket away from this planet just as it is about to be destroyed
This unusual-looking family first seen on "Saturday Night Live" pose as earthlings but are really from Remulak
Etheria is the planet where this title cartoon "Princess of Power" fights the evil horde
A prequel series to "Battlestar Galactica" was named for this planet
George Orwell said most English nonsense verse consists of these, like "See-Saw, Margery Daw", & once may have made sense
In Stephen Leacock's "Nonsense Novels": "A Psychic Pstory of the Psupernatural" & "Maddened by Mystery, or the Defective" this
Beloved nonsense words include this creature that Pooh & Piglet track through the snow--or is it a Wizzle?
The German work "Songs" of this structure for hanging people actually contains jolly nonsense like "the sniffle"
This 19th century giant of nonsense wrote of "The Owl & the Pussy-Cat" & also of nutcrackers running off with sugar tongs
In 1940 Congress said it's a crime to kill this bird
A depiction of a witches' Sabbath, Mussorgsky's composition "Night On Bald Mountain" was used in this 1940 Disney film
In one Norse myth, Loki tricks the god Hoder into throwing a sprig of this parasitic plant at the beloved god Balder, killing him
Found just south of the North Carolina border, 4,784-foot Brasstown Bald is the highest point in this state
This 1950 absurdist play by Eugene Ionesco consists mainly of meaningless dialogues between 2 couples

rounds.text: After Elizabeth II, this queen is the world's wealthiest woman
